t: Job 5
Call*pn out! Will anyone answer you? Which*ln of the holy ones will you turn to?
For*ln anger kills a fool, and*ln jealousy slays the gullible.
I*ln have seen a fool taking root, but*ln I immediately pronounced a curse on his home.
His*ln children are far from safety. They*ln are crushed at the city gate, with*ln no one to rescue them.
The*ln hungry consume his harvest, even*ln taking it out of the thorns. The*ln thirsty pant for his children’s wealth.
For*ln distress does not grow out of the soil, and*ln trouble does not sprout from the ground.
But*ln humans are born for trouble as*ln surely as sparks fly upward.
However,*pn if I were you, I would appeal to God and*ln would present my case to him.
He*ln does great and unsearchable things, wonders*ln without number.
He*ln gives rain to the earth and*ln sends water to the fields.
He*ln sets the lowly on high, and*ln mourners are lifted to safety.
He*ln frustrates the schemes of the crafty so*ln that they achieve no success.
He*ln traps the wise in their craftiness so*ln that the plans of the deceptive are*ln quickly brought to an end.
They*ln encounter darkness by day, and*ln they grope at noon as*ln if it were night.
He*ln saves the needy from their sharp words and*ln from the clutches of the powerful.
So*ln the poor have hope, and*ln injustice shuts its mouth.
See*ln how happy is the person whom God corrects; so*ln do not reject the discipline of the Almighty.
For*ln he wounds but he also bandages; he*ln strikes, but his hands also heal.
He*ln will rescue you from six calamities; no*ln harm will touch you in seven.
In*ln famine he will redeem you from death, and*ln in battle, from the power of the sword.
You*ln will be safe from slander and*ln not fear destruction when it comes.
You*ln will laugh at destruction and hunger and*ln not fear the land’s wild creatures.
For*ln you will have a covenant with the stones of the field, and*ln the wild animals will be at peace with you.
You*ln will know that your tent is secure, and*ln nothing will be missing when you inspect your home.
You*ln will also know that your offspring will be many and*ln your descendants like the grass of the earth.
You*ln will approach the grave in full vigor, as*ln a stack of sheaves is gathered in its season.
We*pn have investigated this, and it is true! Hear*ln it and understand it for yourself.
